intro: Lessertia margaritacea, commonly known as the pearl plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub characterized by its small, fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silky hair. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that contains several seeds.
